alert.note: Alert for Fayette; Lamar; Marion; Pickens (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 3:44PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Marion, northern Pickens, Fayette and Lamar Counties through 415 PM CDT... At 344 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Lamar County Airport to Bigbee Valley. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Winfield, Fayette, Vernon, Sulligent, Reform, Millport, Carrollton, Pickensville, Guin, Berry, Brilliant, Glen Allen, Kennedy, Belk, Beaverton, Gu-Win, Ethelsville, Memphis, Bluff and Blooming Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
